citeinfo.origin: Christine Kandzela and Richard Wilmot. (AFSC Quarterly Report: Jul. - Sep. 2002) Alaska Fisheries Science Center (AFSC), National Marine Fisheries Service (NMFS), National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration (NOAA)
citeinfo.title: Origin of Juvenile Chum Salmon From Gulf of Alaska Coastal Waters, 2001

descript.abstract: Use large-scale hatchery thermal mark programs to study the migration, distribution, growth, and survival of fish stock. Make use of genetic analyses that take advantage of the genetic divergence that exists among regional groups of populations.
descript.purpose: To provide updated information on salmon migration patterns in the GOA, relying upon migration and distribution data from thermally marked chum salmon hatchery stocks and the first genetic stock identification analysis of juvenile salmon migrating through this coastal corridor.
